title: GCF of Terms
text: Find the greatest common factor of all the terms of the polynomial.
speech: Find the greatest common factor of all the terms of the polynomial.
pacedSpeech: Find the greatest common factor of all the terms of the polynomial.

title: Factor into Primes
speech: Factor  8 y  and  16  into primes.\n 8 y is equal to 2 times 2 times 2 y \n 16 is equal to, 2 times 2 times 2 times 2
pacedSpeech: into primes.  8 y is equal to 2 times 2 times 2 y
16 is equal to, 2 times 2 times 2 times 2

title: Multiply Common Factors
text: Multiply the terms shared by both expressions.\n$$GCF=2\times2\times2$$\n$$GCF=8$$
speech: Multiply the terms shared by both expressions.\n   g   c   f is equal to 2 times 2 times 2, \n,   g   c   f is equal to 8
pacedSpeech: Multiply the terms shared by both expressions.    g   c   f is equal to 2 times 2 times 2,
,   g   c   f is equal to 8

title: Write each Term as a Product using GCF
text: Rewrite $$8y$$ and $$16$$ as products of their GCF, $$8$$.\n$$8y+16$$\n$$8y+8\times2$$
speech: Rewrite  8 y  and  16  as products of their GCF,  8 .\n 8 y plus 16 \n 8 y, plus 8 times 2

title: Reverse Distributive Property
text: Use the reverse Distributive Property to factor the expression.\n$$8\left(y+2\right)$$
speech: Use the reverse Distributive Property to factor the expression.\n 8 times, parentheses y plus 2,
pacedSpeech: Use the reverse Distributive Property to factor the expression.  8 times,  y plus 2,
